lexUnit.name: amiable.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: friendly and pleasant in manner.

sentence.text: But the look of dislike , which Alice was afraid might be what Roberta did feel for her , was replaced with Roberta 's more amiable look , and she sat up , feeling for cigarettes .
From an early age , Shah Jehan made it clear that he did not care for his third son , and instead increasingly lavished attention on the more amiable Dara Shukoh .
He sounded more amiable than before , more inclined to be helpful .
Warton wrote to James Boswell [ q.v. ] in 1786 : ‘ She was a very ingenious poetess … and , on the whole , was a most sensible , agreeable , and amiable woman . ’
What possible motive could this round , friendly , most amiable of men have for murder ?
With his dyed hair , multiple earrings and parachute boots , he might present a formidable sight to some , but he 's one of the most amiable punks you could wish to meet .
He was perfectly amiable to her on the few occasions when they did meet ; sometimes she even felt that he liked her .
He looked perfectly amiable , so why did she get this feeling of apprehension , as though he was playing some sort of waiting game ?
But the tall policeman who came to the door was quite amiable .
Harry was enjoying himself : he had been drinking , and was in that pleasant state of semi-inebriation that softened his tongue and turned him into a quite amiable human being .
When she actually spoke to the guy she was quite amiable .
Like so many kindly , amiable people , he was a confirmed gossip and loved to prattle about his friends ' affairs .
He was a very kind , youngish , amiable scholar of great distinction , and a power in the university .
Calatin was very amiable indeed .
Wardle 's solicitor , and Pickwick 's , an amiable , astute little man .
This amiable young man greeted me enthusiastically and informed me that he would be driving me himself , in his motor car which he had brought from Finland .
The amiable Downpatrick man will beam into living-rooms every Friday throughout the autumn from September 17 .
` Because I did n't feel like chatting , " I said in an amiable tone , ` I did n't feel like seeing anyone .
` You do n't take notes here unless I request it , " he had informed Buchanan in an amiable tone .

Some able-bodied seamen , perhaps deciding that if they could n't have a night on the town , they 'd have the drinks they liked among people who talked in recognizable languages , were mixing with the Italians and French and their amiable women .
I am glad you like Mr. Gould : — he has been always very obliging to me — although I never knew him till lately : Mrs. G. appears an exceedingly pleasant & amiable woman .

Following the death of Cromwell in September 1658 , Richard took over as Lord Protector , but proved too weak and amiable to control parliament , particularly as the army and the majority of the gentry preferred the restoration of the monarchy .
The amiable Mr Charest has , in Gilbertian style , said nothing in particular and said it very well .
With a little effort she managed to be reasonably amiable throughout supper , even refraining from a caustic retort when he complimented her cooking .
Nik Cohn , the writer , described him as , ` an amiable fatman from Catford , a bit of a slag and conspicuously so but shrewd , funny and hard to dislike . "
There was an awkward silence which Maidstone might have broken with some amiable remark to save Sandison 's face .
An amiable , approachable individual of wide interests , he rapidly became known to his subjects as ` Farmer George " .
Often I would see Clary , with his guitar strumming familiar tunes , accompanied by his hoarse , amiable voice , enticing an audience as they laughed along with him .
His own wit was ruefully amiable .
Throughout the weeks on the stump he remained entirely amiable , even if his nice smile sometimes seemed the work of a plastic surgeon .
Outside of them , her manner was genial and her expression amiable , contributing to Aristophanes ' pleasure as well as his profits .
Sidney looked amiable , a little stupid , and very much out of his element .
The science and engineering master was always amiable .
He had already begun to establish friendly relations with the man , portraying himself meanwhile as an amiable if somewhat tedious fellow with francophobic leanings .
He was amiable enough over the port .
The third man , who does not look amiable at all , is the great Mr George Carman QC .
John Bland , as amiable a sportsman as one would wish to meet , is naturally disturbed and disheartened by the increasing number of tournaments in which he , as a South African , can not compete .
